HTML & CSS 1 - Lesson 2

Part 2

Discussion

CSS and The Cascade

Understanding the cascading properties of CSS will allow us to write more efficiant CSS.

Layering Styles with Multiple Classes

You will learn to understand how a selector can be used to define specificity in your CSS.

Calculating Properties

Every selector in CSS has a specificity weight. A selector's specificity weight, along with its placement in the cascade, identifies how its styles will be rendered.

Practice

Calculating Properties

We will run through some examples of specificity to detirmine what styles will be applied.

Discussion

Common CSS Property Values

Specifically, we'll look at property values that relate to colors and length measurements.

CSS Colors

All color values within CSS are defined on an sRGB (or standard red, green, and blue) color space.

CSS Lengths

Length values within CSS are similar to colors in that there are a handful of different types of values.
